name: Aztec restoration #11
description: Detail from plate 40 of the 16th century Aztec Codex Laud, depicting a fanged priest making an offering of a flower to a ghostly animal spirit with a snake tail for a tongue. A ritual ball court is depicted with a severed jaguar tail, ritual girdle and rubber ball. The animal spirit emanates from the priest himself in a coiling plume of fur and feathers.
